item.title: Thomas Jefferson Said "Government That Governs Least Governs Best."
item.description:
Thomas Jefferson said that “Goverment that governs least governs best.”

— Mike Pence, interview on Fox & Friends

Claims:

Thomas Jefferson Said "Government That Governs Least Governs Best."
The Truth:
It’s often misattributed to him, but he never said it.

Fact Checks:

PolitiFact
Pence repeated a saying often associated with Jefferson, but research showed the writer of the Declaration of Independence never said it.

item.title: James Comey's Firing Unrelated to Russia Investigation
item.description:
That’s not what — let me be clear with you — that was not what this is about. That’s not what this is about.

— Mike Pence, press conference

Claims:

James Comey's Firing Unrelated to Russia Investigation
The Truth:
President Trump confirmed the connection.

Fact Checks:

The Washington Post
Trump himself blew all of that up a day later, telling NBC News’s Lester Holt that he had already decided to fire Comey and would have done it regardless of the DOJ’s recommendation. Trump also said clearly that the Russia probe was on his mind. “When I decided to [fire Comey], I said to myself, you know, this Russia thing with Trump and Russia is a made-up story,” he said.
NBC News
The White House also initially said it was Comey’s handling of the Hillary Clinton investigation — not Russia — as the reason behind the firing. But in the interview with Holt, Trump mentioned Russia as a rationale.
